Reviews.Title: “Going cheap doesn't pay...”
Reviews.Author: Danigeil
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed about this Hotel, I booked in London through Venere, because of its low rate and convenient location. I did check reviews and now I am surprised why they are all good. The truth is, this is a hotel, I wanted to leave the moment I checked in. My room #2 in the basement seemed dirty and ran down. I even bought sandals to walk around. I didn't have towels, got them after asking but only one. On 2nd night water from bathroom on top was dripping and flooding my own bathroom. I ask to be changed, but it wasn't possible. I had to shower in another used bathroom, from where a guest just left! Showers are tiny, you really cannot bend in there! Poor furniture, burned out lights, bad odors, when bathroom of room above was being used. It was also very loud, you could here other guests come & go, using bathrooms, showers, etc. specially those living above my room. Disgusting view to an abandoned indoor patio, from a window. I kept all the time the curtain closed. Location was fine, and I was glad though to have free WiFi as well as an old fridge and microwave. Because of the flooding a guy at reception (I think manager) offered me they would reimburse a night, which didn't happen. Staff was friendly and nice, but at the end I was very happy to leave and do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good one”
Reviews.Author: Birikkina
Reviews.Content: 4 ladies, 5 nights, january 2012 Room on the top (4th floor) 2 king size beds and 2 single, small fridge, small kitchen with microwave and tea maker. Four cups and 3 dishes - better to buy it plastic in Sainsbury's (2 mins away) as you don't have any detergent. Enough space, two windows, small tv (as someone said, it was the size of an iPod). There is absolutely no space in the bathroom (even the sink is that little one you have no space to wash your hands), so you have to leave all your beauty-case & co. in the room. Great location, calm area, bus nr 74 (bus stop one block away, on Cromwell street) takes you directly to the center (Victoria, Picadilly..). Use Oyster! When we were there they were fixing the sewerage so we had some toilet problems, now it should probablly be ok. The stuff is great, they are reeeeeally helpful and kind. Overall: low budget + good location + great transfer connections + everything you need around the corner + nice stuff = We'll be back :) ..after all, you don't go to London to cook and watch tv.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very quiet, pleasant surroundings, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A W
Reviews.Content: Positive: - Location. Pleasant surroundings, tube station with little shops, pubs and restaurants nearby only a 3 minute walk away. Direct transfer connections to Victoria and Piccadilly Circus either by tube or by bus (bus station is also only a 2 minute walk away). Supermarket (Sainsbury's) only 2-3 minutes from the hotel. - Cleanliness. Both the room and especially the bathroom were surprisingly clean! - Friendly staff - Our room (and I think most others) was the only one on the floor and was oriented towards a backyard, it was really really quiet at night! Neutral-Negative: - The room was really small, and actually completely filled out by the bed; no wardrobe, just a crooked commode (we were unable to open the drawers) -The "fully equipped kitchen" in fact consisted of a water kettle and 2 cups. I think there is 1 family room with a kitchen, but the other rooms clearly don't have any. There is also no shared kitchen. - The bathroom was seperated from the bedroom only by a ramshackle folding door. ALL IN ALL: Still, great value for money. It's still a great hostel and we'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mikoraud
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for four nights in the beginning of February 2012, averaged 40GBP a night. For the money it was good. Yes, it's a bit shabby, and when my son first saw our TV, he said it was the size of our iPad. But if a nice bed in a good quiet region in London is what you're after, this one fits the bill. What made it very good, though, was the staff. Always attentive and helpful, with good advice to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: hrof
Reviews.Content: Good value of money for a family room ,nice clean room , great staff. Excellent budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lucky escape”
Reviews.Author: cathmac59
Reviews.Content: Booked this "hotel" thru my usual hotel booking site, thought the reviews looked ok and I was familiar with the location and thought I'd go for it. Arrived about 9pm at night and admittedly it didnt look great, reception shabby, quite dingy really but I thought ok, no problem, I'm a seasoned traveller, I can deal with this. But suddenly found I couldnt, when I was shown into a room that was NOT a proper room, just behind the reception area, and I MEAN just sharing a thin wall with "reception" which was a desk with a bloke behind it all night! The room was extremely dingy, "bathroom" a joke, shower a mess...ok everything looked "clean" but the state of repair was appalling...broken tiles and a huge shower caddy thing to one side of the shower ON THE FLOOR that really shouldn't have been there, a small wash hand basin, taps almost hanging off.. The bed was basic sheet and stupid looking fleece throw over it. Hello? Whats that all about?? Reception just through a thin wall..I could hear the bloke moving stuff around all night! It seemed like he was moving boxes around the floor, even at 3.40 am. I really didnt feel comfortable or safe as a single traveller. Next day I railed up AT 7.30 am, saw the manager EVENTUALLY at 10am who offered a room on the 3rd floor but it was too late for me, i couldnt wait to see the back of the place. Had to fight for a refund of my remaining 3 nights, as for some reason this hotel asks for the money upfront PLUS a suspicious credit card charge, which my booking site didn't highlight. All in all, a lucky escape. Never again. Wouldn't recommend this "hotel" to anyone. Now I'm not a picky traveller, I can stay most places if the price is right...well used to staying in cities all over the world on my own, but this has to be the worst experience I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,excellent stuff,clean room,good price,100% satisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: Nikolai1984
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel in December 2011,very good location,we needed help about what sites is best to visit in the city and the stuff was very helpful,explained to us step by step how and where to go,it's maked our stay excellent,we did the maximum in our 5 days that we been at the hotel.The room was very clean,and we will stay in this hotel next time that we will be in London.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a 2 night break at this hotel. The room was lovely and the hotel was very clean. When we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed by a friendly receptionist who took our cases to reception. Checkin was easy and we were offered map,informatin....... was a nice gesture. Excellent location near to lots of restaurants and shops. Room was bright and cheerful. Nothing was any bother to the staff. Would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the location was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ellisha R
Reviews.Content: the location was excellent,I simply must say, that the staff was fantastic! We have never experienced so much kindness, attentiveness and servicemindedness from any staff on any other hotel, than what we experienced on 37 Collingham Place.value for money , We will definitely returm with great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap Hotel,Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel,Friendly staff,recommended Great location and good room for the price Generally good hotel, good value for the location, just a few hundred metres from Harrods,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, will book this hotel again &will recommend it as well”
Reviews.Author: 20Micheal20
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a night down in London to see the hubbies' favourite band at The Royal Albert Hall. Perfect location, just round the corner from Earls Court tube station. Lovely clean hotel, just my cup of tea! The room we had was clean,good size,nice flat screen tv on the wall microwave,fridge ,hair dryer at resonable price Overall though a lovely stay and will book this hotel again &will recommend it as well

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very poor WIFI internet access.”
Reviews.Author: kurbiaziz
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable rate. Call hotel directly for best rate. Location was fantastic, just 1 block away from Earls Court Tube station and walking distance to the Natural History Museum, (small donation, 3 pounds). Abundant amount of restaurants from asian, middle eastern, american, indian and much more within walking distance. Hotel staff is great and very helpful. Less than average housecleaning, kept forgetting to give us toilet paper, and towels on a regular basis.. No elevator, we stayed at the 4th floor, very narrow staircase and some steps are a little lose, be careful. VERY POOR WIFI INTERNET! Do not expect it to work, only way for me to access the wifi was to walk down the stairs and stand next to check in counter. Very Irritating! They state that they have WIFI, do not expect it to work. Overall a inexpensive way to enjoy London with very few extras at the hotel. Would use again for the good rate.

HotelInfo.Name: 37 Collingham Place London
HotelInfo.Address: 37 Collingham Place | Earls Court, London SW5 0QF, England
